message.content: This question asks us to identify a positive impact on the bio environment. Option (D), making sure trash is reused for new reasons, is the correct answer because it promotes recycling and reduces waste. It helps to minimize the negative impact on the environment by reducing the need for new resources and preventing pollution. Options (A), (B), and (C) are all examples of harmful activities that have negative impacts on the bio environment as they involve dumping toxic waste, contaminating the ground, and contributing to pollution through mass production.

This question requires knowledge about positive impacts on the environment. Option (D), making sure trash is reused for new reasons, is the correct answer because it promotes recycling and reduces waste in landfills. Options (A), (B), and (C) are all negative impacts on the environment as they involve pollution and contamination.

This question requires an understanding of environmental impacts and sustainability. Dumping toxic waste in rivers (option A) and contaminating the ground with poison (option B) are both negative impacts on the bio environment as they can harm ecosystems and living organisms. Building cars in large numbers (option C) can contribute to air pollution and resource depletion. Option D is the correct answer because ensuring that trash is reused for new purposes reduces the amount of waste sent to landfills and promotes recycling, which is beneficial for the environment.

This question requires an understanding of the concept of positive impacts on the bio environment. Options (A), (B), and (C) are all examples of negative impacts on the bio environment as they involve pollution and contamination.

Option (C) does not provide any information about whether building cars in large numbers has a positive or negative impact on the bio environment. Option (D) is the correct answer because reusing trash for new purposes reduces waste and helps to conserve resources, which has a positive impact on the bio environment.
